page.title: 06Peak Dale Church Centenary
page.content: Peak Dale's Holy Trinity Church was built in 1885.It was finished and opened in 1886,and cost Â£1800 to build.The first marriage was in 1909. The church has got one warden, a bell, a canteen, an altar, a reading stand and some seats.It was intended that the church would have an 85ft tower to house a bell,but unfortunately there wasn't enough money. The seats were given to the church by a man called Chapman, and they are made out of pine. In 1940 an organ was given to the church.The man who played the organ was buried in the church, he was a school master and was aged 32. The centenary celebrations start on September 26th 1985, and carry on into the next year.During the celebrations they plan to hold a special service,
